agilermi

Class RmiRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • agilermi.RmiRegistry

  • public class RmiRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a simple class that accepts new TCP connections over a port of the local machine and automatically creates and manages the object sockets to export remote objects. It integrates a registry of exported objects. The instances of this class can be shared among more than one RmiHandler to obtain a multi-peer interoperability.
    Author:
    Salvatore Giampa'

      • RmiRegistry

        public RmiRegistry(int port,
                   boolean daemon,
                   javax.net.ServerSocketFactory ssFactory,
                   javax.net.SocketFactory sFactory,
                   boolean enableListener)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new Object server with a new empty object registry
        Parameters:
        port - the port to listen on
        daemon - set to false to create a non-daemon listener thread (shuts down when all the application is terminated)
        ssFactory - a custom factory to create server sockets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I\O error occurs

      • getStub

        public java.lang.Object getStub(java.lang.String address,
                                int port,
                                java.lang.String objectId,
                                java.lang.Class<?>... stubInterfaces)
                         throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                java.io.IOException
        Gets the stub for the specified object identifier on the specified host respect to the given interface. Similar to the RmiHandler#getStub(String, Class) method, but creates a new ObjectPeer if necessary to communicate with the specified host.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the stub object
        Parameters:
        address - the host address
        port - the host port
        objectId - the remote object identifier
        stubInterface - the stub's interface
        Returns:
        the stub object
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host address cannot be resolved
        java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur

      • getRmiHandler

        public RmiHandler getRmiHandler(java.lang.String host,
                                int port)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Gets the RmiHandler object for the specified host. If it has not been created, creates it.
        Parameters:
        address - the host address
        port - the host port
        Returns:
        the object peer related to the specified host
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - if the host address cannot be resolved
        java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur

      • enableListener

        public void enableListener(int port,
                           boolean daemon)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Enable the registry listener on the selected port. This method enables the registry to accept new external incoming connections for RMI
        Parameters:
        port - the port to start the listener on
        daemon - if true, the listener is started as daemon, that is it will be stopped when all other non-daemon threads in the application will bterminated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur

      • publish

        public void publish(java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.Object object)
        Publish the given object respect to the specified interface.
        Parameters:
        objectId - the identifier to use for this service
        object - the implementation of the service to publish
        remoteIf - the interface of the service to publish
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified identifier was already bound or if the objectId parameter matches the automatic referencing objectId pattern that is /\#[0-9]+/

      • getRemoteObjectId

        public java.lang.String getRemoteObjectId(java.lang.Object object)
        Package-level operation used to get the identifier of a service
        Parameters:
        object - the service implementation
        remoteIf - the service interface
        Returns:
        the associated identifier or null if no entry was found

      • exportInterface

        public void exportInterface(java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Marks an interface to automatically create remote references for objects that are sent as arguments for an invocation or as return values. The objects are automatically published on this registry when the related parameter of the stub method has a type that matches with the marked interface
        Parameters:
        remoteIf - the interface to mark

      • unexportInterface

        public void unexportInterface(java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Remove a automatic referencing mark for the interface. See the ObjectRegistry#exportInterface(Class) method. All the objects automatically referenced until this call, remains published in the registry.
        Parameters:
        remoteIf - the interface to unmark

      • isRemote

        public boolean isRemote(java.lang.Class<?> remoteIf)
        Check if an interface is marked for automatic referencing. See the ObjectRegistry#exportInterface(Class) method.
        Parameters:
        remoteIf - the interface to check
        Returns:
        true if the interface is marked for automatic referencing, false otherwise
